sense.name: travel or move in an upwards direction
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] ASCEND NP2[goal/location] NP1[theme] ASCEND PP[location]
sense.examples: The climbers ascended the mountain slowly. Many exploreres tried to ascend this river to its headwaters. Will the new CEO be able to ascend the many legal and financial obstacles confronting him? See the moon ascending over the far shore of the lake?

sense.name: go back in time geneologically
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[abstract] ASCEND ADVP NP1[abstract] ASCEND PP[temporal] Note: the PP ADVP are understood as being in a temporal relationship to subject NP
sense.examples: Inheritence may not ascend linearly. Do humans have genes that ascend to the roundish flatworm?

sense.name: enter into or acquire a higher status (social)
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[benefactor] ASCEND NP2 NP1[benefactor] ASCEND PP[state]
sense.examples: The princess ascended the throne after the prince's demise. In just ten years they have ascended from poverty to great wealth.

sense.name: be oriented or situated with one end higher than the other.
sense.examples: The forest path ascends to the top of the hill. The spiral staircase ascended only to the second floor.

sense.name: go toward a river's (or similar) source.
